identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of the KPCXM18 Injection for Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel, Placebo-controlled Phase II Clinical Trial Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of the KPCXM18 Injection in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, parallel, placebo-controlled trial design to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the KPCXM18 injection at different doses for the treatment of acute ischemic stroke and its PK/PD characteristics in patients.

armGroups.label: low-dose group （The KPCXM18 injection）
armGroups.description: Intravenous infusion of 20 mg twice daily at intervals of 12±2 hours for 10 days.

armGroups.label: middle-dose group （The KPCXM18 injection）
armGroups.description: Intravenous infusion of 60 mg twice daily at intervals of 12±2 hours for 10 days.

armGroups.label: high-dose group （The KPCXM18 injection）
armGroups.description: Intravenous infusion of 100 mg twice daily at intervals of 12±2 hours for 10 days.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Intravenous infusion twice a day with an interval of 12±2 hours for 10 days.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in NIHSS score from baseline at day 10 after administration
primaryOutcomes.description: The National Institute of Health stroke scale(NIHSS) score ranging from 0-42. Higher score indicates worse function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of subjects with mRS score ≤ 1 at day 90±7 after administration
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Modified Rankin Scale(mRS) score ranging from 0-5. Higher score indicates worse function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in BI score from baseline at day 90±7 after administration
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Barthel Index score ranges from 0 to 100, the higher scores mean a better outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in EQ-5D score from baseline at day 90±7 after administration
Changes in NIHSS score from baseline on days 30±3 and 90±7 after administration
secondaryOutcomes.description: The National Institute of Health stroke scale(NIHSS) score ranging from 0-42. Higher score indicates worse function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in mRS score from baseline on days 30±3 and 90±7 after administration
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Modified Rankin Scale(mRS) score ranging from 0-5. Higher score indicates worse function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of subjects whose NIHSS score improved by ≥4 points at days 10, 30±3 and 90±7 after administration
secondaryOutcomes.description: The National Institute of Health stroke scale(NIHSS) score ranging from 0-42. Higher score indicates worse function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of subjects with recurrence of stroke within 90±7 days after administration
Changes in serum biomarkers (TNF-α, MMP9, CHE, IL-10, S100-β) from baseline on day 7 after administration
